qas.question: When did comic supplements start showing up in Japan?
Who introduced satirical strips to Japan?
Who started the first Japanese comic strip in modern times?
When did comic strips start appearing in hardback collection volumes?
When did comic supplements stop showing up in Japan?
When did comic supplements start showing up in China?
Who never introduced satirical strips to Japan?
Who started the last Japanese comic strip in modern times?

context: Illustrated magazines for <a1_0><b7_0>Western expatriates<b7_0/><a1_0/> introduced Western-style satirical cartoons to Japan in the late 19th century. New publications in both the Western and Japanese styles became popular, and at the end of the <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>1890s<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, American-style newspaper comics supplements began to appear in Japan, as well as some American comic strips. <a2_0><b8_0>1900<b8_0/><a2_0/> saw the debut of the Jiji Manga in the Jiji Shinpō newspaper—the first use of the word "manga" in its modern sense, and where, in 1902, <a3_0><b9_0>Rakuten Kitazawa<b9_0/><a3_0/> began the first modern Japanese comic strip. By the <a4_0>1930s<a4_0/>, comic strips were serialized in large-circulation monthly girls' and boys' magazine and collected into hardback volumes.
